intro: Terebinthus acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed terebinth, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically followed by clustered, fleshy fruits. Its bark is thick and flaky, often exuding a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
